title: Proposal: time.MustParse
body:
I find myself writing something along the lines of:

```
const (
    somelayout = "…"
    sometime = ""…"
    someothertime = "…"
)

t, err := time.Parse(somelayout, sometime)
if err != nil {
    panic(…)
}
```

fairly frequently; mostly as a `MustParse` function in tests, but also occasionally for vars in my actual program.

Having such a function in the standard library right along side the normal `Parse` function (similar to `regex.Compile` and `regex.MustCompile`) would be very handy, especially when writing tests.

Something simple like the following, would do: https://go-review.googlesource.com/#/c/23734/
